item.title: I went to UK, and took a photo of the Jagex Building
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

dbzmaster555:

What’s with the gun thing all of a sudden. you guys are being irrelevant from the topic.

The gun thing is more interesting.

Mr.Chris:

Mmmkai, well more guns being legal, means that people who want to use a gun for a criminal purpose can get them pretty easy. It wouldn’t be hard to break in to someone elses house while they are out and take their gun. Surely, having more guns would mean more shooting, which means more deaths and injuries through gun related crime.

You are correct in a general sort of way - more guns in existence increases the chance that a gun will be fired somewhere for some purpose. But if it’s so easy to get a gun, why would you bother breaking into someone’s house for it? What if his son is at home and knows how to shoot because dad’s been showing him, in the interest of safety, how to handle this potentially dangerous thing in their house? What if the guy took his gun with him, and when he comes back in five minutes and finds you there, he’ll shoot you? Or what if he just decides to hit you in the leg and wait for the cops to show up? The risks associated with crime are much greater when your intended victims might fight back.

The problem with your argument is that it really doesn’t address this other perspective. Yes, more permissive gun laws would allow more people to carry guns. Some of them might even be criminals. But the vast majority of people just want to live their lives. For those who aren’t content to let others be, suddenly looking down the barrel of a Glock 20 should do a lot to change their minds.

Under ideally implemented laws, there would never be a person who just runs out for a bit and leaves the gun at home. You’d have it, constantly. And in such a place, even if you chose not to carry a gun, you would receive the benefits of being assumed armed simply because everyone else is.

Simply put: when you might have to back up your offensive actions with your life, it makes you really eager to get along with people.

side note: It is very possible for criminals and various other violently-inclined folks to get weapons, in spite of laws to the contrary.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:50, topic:73814”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=108405.msg1087144#msg1087144 date=1175648619]
It’s good to know that somebody is ‘sticking it to the man’
[/quote]

Mopman doesn’t carry a gun I shouldn’t think. Where I live, there’s not one person I know who owns a gun, and I know many people in the ‘under world’. Places like Manchester, London and Birmingham is where all the major gun crime is.[/quote]

I don’t walk to the shops with one, but I have quick access to one when martial law is instantiated.
That’s pretty much the only reason I would want a gun, I’m not a dealer or lawyer.

Read full topic

item.title: I went to UK, and took a photo of the Jagex Building
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest: You seem to be under the impression that nobody in England carries a gun. As I’ve said to other anti-gun control americans before, many of us do, we just can’t talk about it as freely. It’s not a great situation to be in, but our governments have been pro-control for years now and will never change, so it will have to do.

It’s kind of like the drug war - I can bitch about how bad it is for hours, but I know it’s very unlikely to change in my lifetime. This dosen’t stop me getting stoned.

Read full topic
item.source: I went to UK, and took a photo of the Jagex Building

item.title: I went to UK, and took a photo of the Jagex Building
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:43, topic:73814”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=108405.msg1086841#msg1086841 date=1175645740]
Actually gun control makes crime go up. As I said in another thread think about this: In america, if you want to rob a bank you have to consider the strong possibility that multiple people in that bank just might have guns on them. In england, you don’t have to worry about that at all. So you would be much more likely to rob the bank in england than in america, where you have to think about possible consequences.
[/quote]

I see what you mean, but there is always another side of the argument. I’m on the side that says more guns == more crime.[/quote]

You are entitled to your opinion, even if it is wrong. Here is an article I found about the concealed carry law that was put into effect recently where I live in ohio:

http://www.ohioccw.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=3004&Itemid=67

Read full topic

[/quote]

But I don’t see what you mean because you haven’t backed up your opinion.[/quote]

Mmmkai, well more guns being legal, means that people who want to use a gun for a criminal purpose can get them pretty easy. It wouldn’t be hard to break in to someone elses house while they are out and take their gun. Surely, having more guns would mean more shooting, which means more deaths and injuries through gun related crime.

Youth in England seems to think that the only think to do with a gun, is too shoot black teenagers for no reason.

@yakman - The picture wasn’t of the whole development team, and Andrew had his face covered

iv been to cambridge a few times, although it never occured to me to try to find out where the jagex offices are, i was more intrested in the univercity there, ;D

about that dead guy who got shot, that was like the day after a terrorist bombing, the policeman told the man to stop, but since the man was an illegal immigrant, he started running, so the policeman, assuming the worse, raised his weapon and fired
the media had a lot to say about this, but im telling you, if a policeman says stop, you [size=10pt]STOP[/size]

a while ago i was looking back into the runescape update history, and on a very far back one, there was a picture of the runescape development team, ill see if i can find it again

hey mopar, do you own a gun yourself?

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Actually gun control makes crime go up. As I said in another thread think about this: In america, if you want to rob a bank you have to consider the strong possibility that multiple people in that bank just might have guns on them. In england, you don’t have to worry about that at all. So you would be much more likely to rob the bank in england than in america, where you have to think about possible consequences.

I see what you mean, but there is always another side of the argument. I’m on the side that says more guns == more crime.

item.title: I went to UK, and took a photo of the Jagex Building
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:40, topic:73814”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=108405.msg1086733#msg1086733 date=1175644822]

Who would shoot you in the head? Law-abiding citizens and even policeman (or so I’ve heard) don’t have guns over there.

Police carry guns all over London now. Armed police often stop Muslim people with bags and search them. Did you not here about that guy who got shot in the head for jumping a ticket barrier?
[/quote]

So they are finally getting some sense in their head and realizing that outlawing guns is doing nothing but increasing crime? Good for them, the next step is to allow law-abiding citizens to carry guns as well.

And no, I had not heard about that incident, your previous comment actually makes sense to me now. :)[/quote]

It was meant to be a joke. I /wrists when no one got it

I’m not sure about citizens having guns though :\ I think crime rates would go up imo. Gun crime is already pretty high. We are more in need of a Gun amnesty instead of making them legal.
